_comment: Minimal device profile with DEFAULT transport and 1 numeric alarm rule (temperature). POST to /api/deviceProfile to create. Replace ${RULE_CHAIN_ID} with the actual rule chain UUID. The alarm 'id' field should be a fresh UUID (uuid4). Alarm rules require a TbDeviceProfileNode in the rule chain to evaluate.
_usage: 1. Create rule chain first (get ${RULE_CHAIN_ID}). 2. Replace placeholders. 3. POST to /api/deviceProfile. 4. Uses optimistic locking -- for updates, GET first, modify, then POST (retry on 409).
name: ${PROFILE_NAME}
description: Device profile with alarm rules. Replace name and description.

defaultRuleChainId._comment: Links this profile to a custom rule chain. Devices with this profile route messages through this chain instead of the root chain.

transportConfiguration._comment: DEFAULT transport accepts MQTT/HTTP/CoAP. For MQTT-specific or LwM2M profiles, change type accordingly.

alarms._comment: Alarm rule: triggers CRITICAL when temperature > 85, WARNING when > 70, clears when < 60. Each alarm needs a unique UUID in the 'id' field. Severity levels in createRules are evaluated highest-first (CRITICAL before WARNING).

key._comment: TIME_SERIES means the alarm evaluates against telemetry data. Use ATTRIBUTE for attribute-based alarms.

spec._comment: SIMPLE spec triggers immediately. Other options: DURATION (must persist for N seconds), REPEATING (must occur N times).

clearRule._comment: Clear rule auto-resolves the alarm when condition is met. The alarm transitions to CLEARED_UNACK status.
